text: I stayed at Byasa and felt welcome from the start. They went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are air conditioned, extremely clean and well maintained. There is a restaurant on property. The food is fresh and delicious. By the end of my stay I almost felt like family.
title: So welcoming

text: I recently stayed in Byasa for 5 nights with my friends and I can honestly say it was one of the most welcoming and friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in. I would go back tomorrow if I had the chance. The hotel and pool and was in a great location with a quick walk to the shops but what wins for this hotel is the staff are absolutely amazing. The hotel staff are out of this world fantastic!! So accommodating and honestly couldn't do more for us as a group. It was honestly a home away from home!!!!
title: Amazing place!!

text: I stayed for 5 nights and had a wonderful experience at Byasa Ubud. The owners Pande and Ayu and all of their staff were super friendly and helpful. They helped me organise a taxi pickup from the airport for a 1am arrival including attending to anything else that I needed. I just wish I had had more time to chill out by the pool which is so tranquil because it is right next to a rice field. Would stay there again and highly recommended!
title: Wonderful stay

text: The Byasa is a shinning example of splendorous hospitality and the joy it creates. The staff and hosts deliver a rare customer service at the highest of standards wrapped in the real respect and appreciation they have for their guests and each other. The rooms are very large, impeccable and very comfortable. You can taste the love that goes into the complimentary breakfasts The view of the rice fields being worked next door and the nearby temple is a treasured vision of traditional Balinese culture thriving.  It's about 5 mins walk from the center of Ubud and all the wonderful surrounding creative activities. I cannot recommend the Byasa enough, we didn't want to leave. Just go there, and give my love to Ayu and Pandi.
title: A Hidden Gem

text: Great family atmosphere.  Staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Food in the restaurant was beautiful. Room spacious and luxurious. Bed very comfy. Nice thick pillows. Best place i have ever stayed in.....ever!!!!
title: Excellent hotel

text: A great quiet, peaceful place to stay.  Views of rice fields and still close to town.  Staff so friendly and owner Ayu willing to assist with any of your requirements !!   Definitely a go to place in Ubud !!
title: Relaxing and Quiet

text:
We have just spent 4 wonderful nights at the Byasa.
The rooms were comfortable, spacious and clean with a fabulous view of the pool and local rice paddies.
The staff were helpful and accommodating, going above and beyond to ensure our stay was one to remember.
title: Home away from home

text: Our fourth trip to Bali and we finally found the perfect spot to stay nestled over a rice field these 9 units are very well appointed (especially for $55 a day) with twice daily service, a great balcony view, HUGE (eggs, fried rice or noodles, toast, potatoes, fruit, banana pancakes, you name it and it is delicious) breakfasts in the pavilion,afternoon tea and sweets,  an excellent restaurant when you just get off the plane and can't bear to go out...and SERVICE with a smile. You feel part of the family...they give you a phone to call when you are ready for tea, when you get lost, when you are at dinner and need a taxi home....you are pampered and loved by the amazing staff who not only call you by name, but go well beyond the call of duty to help you. The owners are fantastic and really care about making your experience perfect and they live on the property so they are very very hands on.  STAY HERE. Period...every place else pales by comparison.
title: MUST STAY HERE...great accommodations, staff, breakfast, view...ALL  PERFECT!!

text: I stayed at Byasa recently for four nights and had a wonderful stay. The staff was so kind and accommodating, the room was clean and the location was great for exploring Ubud! Would recommend to a friend for sure!
title: Wonderful, hospitable hotel in a great location

text: Very simply one of the best hotels we stayed at in Bali. This hotel in Ubud is truly a hidden gem. From the Rooms, to the Breakfast Menu (not forgetting the Afternoon Tea), to the attentive and kind hearted staff and its location and peaceful setting....it is a hotel you will want to return to time and again. Lovely Pool as well. Really good value for money. Special mention to Ayu, one of the Owners who is is extremely informative and who very kindly made the time to drop us off at the Airport - a huge thank you.
title: Great Botique Hotel

text: We stayed here for only a couple of nights and wished we had booked more here as it was near perfect the rooms were clean and very comfortable and luxurious and the service was spot on the breakfast very tasty and served on your balcony or in the lovely garden the pool just right for a cooling off dip too would definitely book this hotel again were we to stay in ubud again
title: Excellent

text:
Stayed here based on Tripadvisor reviews - excellent.
Set back from a main road, facing rice padis - so very peaceful.
20 minutes walk to central Ubud (Monkey Forest), but there are plenty of good places to eat within 5-10 mins walk.
Everyone helpful & friendly.
Special mention to owner/cook Ayu - she makes a lunch/dinner Nasi Goreng which is the best I’ve had in 10 years of Indo travel.
title: Deserves the good rating

text: My son and I stayed her for 1 night May 22-23. There is nothing to not love about Byasa. It is right down the road from the Monkey Forest and a short taxi ride from Ubud Center. The staff is amazing and the afternoon tea and breakfast are both EXCELLENT! Our rooms and the pool were immaculate!! Thank you to the staff!
title: Excellent CLEAN and very comfortable

text:
We were in Bali for the first time and moved to this hotel after staying in another one for a 5 days.
In Byasa we found two big advantages that are not typical things for the most places in Bali. Firstly, it’s super clean. Secondly, there are almost no insects inside and that's extremely surprising because in Bali insects are everywhere. In more authentic places you can find them even in your bed, but here we didn’t meet any.
Rooms are simple but nice: it have even bathing caps and toothbrushes in the bathrooms. We didn’t use them but it’s pleasant to know that the staff is thinking about such little things.
The breakfast was large and various. It included two dishes and a fruit plate so we even could't eat it all at one go.
It is about 20-30 minutes walk to the very center of Ubud that is a bit far but still okay. Actually there are lots of shops, warungs and restaurants nearby.
The staff is warm and kind, so there is an atmosphere of prosperity and happiness like all along the island.
In every room windows face the rice field so sometimes you can watch local people working hard while you're chilling on the balcony or near the pool that is also a very pleasant way of spending time.

Oleg & Anya
title: A very nice place to stay in Ubud
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text: We stayed for 3 fantastic nights in Byasa Ubud.First class service from everyone including Mr Pande and Ms Ayu.Every morning wake up to the sounds of nature and an awesome paddy field view from the balcony.Homemade breakfast and tea daily..too delicious to describe.Awesome ,attentive and friendly staff.
title: Awesome stay in Byasa Ubud

text: Byasa is a very clean and tidy place to stay. All staffs are quite kind and much helpful with every details. The breakfast is delicious. Wi-Fi is quick and stable. Swimming pool is very clean. Byasa gave me a cell phone in case there is anything needed then I can call them for help while I was out of Byasa. To stay at Byasa is an amazing experience. Everything is wonderful here.
title: Byasa is my family in Ubud

text: The most attentive staff ever. They did great job in making us feel happy during our stay. The breakfast was great and they bring to your room. Also afternoon tea and turn down service at night, which is not common for this price. Rooms are spacious and modern, more importantly it's quiet.
title: Amazing staff!

text: It was a very wonderful experience on Byasa! I recommend this hotel to anyone who loves to stay in a silent place! The food is just Amazing, very delicious I love it!!! If I can i kidnap the cook and I taking with me!!! Very nice place!!! Try it
title: Wonderful place

text:
Our family of 4 adults and 2 children stayed at Byasa based on the reviews we read on Tripadvisor. Our stay exceeded our expectations. The hotel is truly wonderful and such good value for money. 
The owners and staff are all so genuinely friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them. The rooms are beautiful and spotlessly clean. The breakfast is included in the price and offers a variety to suit all tastes and all home made. The location is perfect just a short stroll into the centre of Ubud. The grounds and pool were very well kept and all rooms have magnificent views over some small rice fields. 
My family were so relaxed and happy here and will definately return.
title: Our favourite place to stay

text:
Our stay here was a delight. We have visited many hotels on our travels around SouthEastAsia but this was exceptional and here are a few reasons why:
A lovely prepared breakfast brought to your balcony, the pancakes were especially nice 

The staff are very professional and always happy. 
The rooms were cleaner then most 5 star hotels we have visited. 
Reasonably priced scooters for rent that are in good condition, which really helped us explore the area. 

The view from the rooms is stunning overlooking palm trees and rice fields complimented with a good sized pool. 

The rooms were very quiet and could only make out a faint amount of road noise. 

For those who are into yoga it’s a very short walk to The Yoga Barn. 

Ayu and her husband are really nice and have done a lovely job at providing a home away from home. I believe it is the best and only place to stay in Ubud in that price range as everything is faultless you really can’t go wrong.
title: A Very Special Place to stay.

text: Wow, I dont even know how to describe my stay here at Byasa Hotel.  The entire staff was SO Friendly and so helpful.  They helped me arrange a motorbike to take me to dinner, and yoga everyday I was there.  The Owner is such an amazing individual, he made sure all my questions were answered and made sure to greet me every time I came downstairs or came back to the hotel.  I cant say enough good things about this hotel.  This is honestly a hidden Ubud Gem.
title: Amazing

text:
I travelled to Bali for the first time and knew that I wanted to be surrounded by lush vegetation and Ubud didn’t disappoint. But as a single lady I also needed a home away from home where I could feel safe on my adventure and Ayu and the Team at Byasa became family during my 7 night stay: thr meals were delicious, laundry service very efficient, the bed was amazing (which was very important to me) and the helpful tour advice they gave was just was I needed to feel comfortable. 

The view from the third floor is the one I’d recommend if you like the overlooking view of a rice paddy: It’s a quiet, boutique hotel with a personal touch. I’d recommend it to anyone and I’ll definitely stay there again!
title: Amazing stay!

text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Byasa for five nights and we LOVED our stay.  It is just off the main road, and a quick walk into town to restaurants and shops.  We had a corner room on the third floor that overlooked a rice field and we enjoyed waking up to that view every morning.  It was so quiet and serene.  We enjoyed having breakfast served in our room (the young gentleman that hauled our food up every morning was a great way to start our day as he always had the largest smile).  Breakfast was so delicious (I am still waiting on the fried rice recipe as it was so good!).  We used the laundry service a few times and it was quite affordable and fast.   Wifi was the fastest we had in Indonesia. We went inside the pool almost everyday, and loved it.  The grounds and the rooms are SO CLEAN.  I am a transplant nurse, so I work in near sterile environments, and if I say it is clean, it's CLEAN!  The people are what makes Byasa stand out from the rest.  Everyone knew our names, and they were so friendly and hospitable.  One day we needed a ride to the other side of town and they took us for free.  I tried paying, and they refused.  One night we were too tired to go into town, so they ordered food for us and delivered it to our room.  The day we left, they all waved us goodbye.  I almost had tears in my eyes!  I HIGHLY recommend staying here if you are in Ubud!
title: Best Place to stay in Ubud!

text: Byasa has excellent reviews for a reason.  It is fantastic! The hotel is tucked off a main road, which is a 10 minute walk to the shops or the staff will happily drop you where you want.  The hotel is very quiet, has beautiful grounds and has only 9 rooms all of which have great views of the pool and rice fields beyond.  The bathroom was exceptionally clean and the beds are very comfortable. The pool was huge and very clean and a pleasure to swim in every day.  They also provide a yummy breakfast and will prepare lunch or dinner if you want it. But the best thing about Byasa are the staff.  Pande, his wife and their staff were all wonderful.  They made our trip so special and nothing was a problem.  I couldn't recommend this place more highly.
title: Amazing accommodation in Ubud

text:
Our vacation in Bali started really wrong. We couldn't enjoy all the beauty and only thanks to Byasa we could save our vacation. In Byasa we could find everything what we were looking for. Great hotel, clean and super friendly people.
But this hotel had much more special then most of the hotels. Everything what they do, they do it with an hart. Not only great breakfast and thee time, you also get personalized advise how to plan your trip in Bali.

We booked this hotel thanks to all great reviews and to be honest its not overrated as I was thinking. Specially when I am really hard person to please. 
The rooms are really nice and comfortable. Also really clean, even in the places that you normally don't expect. You can also book an trip, the best thing is that they spend time to find out what exactly you wish to see. Sometimes or ever more times we were sitting till 12 pm for planning our trips. We could see a lot of places, thanks to excellent planning of Pande.

We booked first for 5 days, I just wanted to be closer to most touristic places. And after that we booked again for 3 days more.
Later on we booked 5 star hotel (near to beach) and even then we wanted still to go back to Byasa. 

Really excellent place and also really peaceful.

Thanks a lot for everything Byasa family!!!
Best people ever.
title: Best hotel in Bali

text: We stayed for 3 nights and everything about our stay was exceptional: room comfortable, spacious and impeccably clean, breakfast generous and tasty, lovely pool and garden.  But most of all, all the staff were incredibly warm, welcoming and helpful.
title: Exceptional!

text:
My friend and I stayed here on a recent trip to Ubud and were blown away by the hotel's beauty, cleanliness, comfort, staff, view, pool and breakfast (basically, everything!) 

Our room was immaculate (the cleanest place I've ever stayed!) and with everything you could possibly need for a short stay. We were picked up from the hotel using their airport transfer service and once we arrived the check in process was very easy and efficient and included lots of helpful Ubud advice too.

We enjoyed a delicious homemade breakfast every morning on our front terrace which included banana pancakes, homemade toast and a choice of cooked eggs, and juices. Breakfast can be ordered earlier if required if you have early morning excursions booked (a very nice touch) and there is tea/coffee and local sweets (as an 'afternoon tea') on offer in the afternoon. This hotel has wonderful views of rice fields as well as their superbly clean pool area, which makes for a stunning start to your day!

The service however was the most amazing aspect of our stay. All Byasa staff make every effort to make you feel at home, remember your name and greet you throughout the day, seem genuinely interested in your enjoyment of the hotel and Ubud and offer their help with anything you might need. You will be given a room mobile phone, for example, as part of your stay which you can use to ring reception with any queries as well as allowing you to ring local numbers e.g takeaways -
 very useful! Everyone who worked at the hotel just seemed very happy in their work and were always smiling, which added to our enjoyment of staying at the hotel generally. 

On one occasion we were waiting for a taxi but were offered a free lift into town by a staff member who was on his way to a concert. This was clearly in his own time and a detour but he refused any payment and seemed happy to help us - what amazing service! Also at the end of our stay we were encouraged to take our time checking out as the next patrons of our room were not arriving until the evening - very appreciated and again fantastic service until the very end!

Byasa's location is also great for a short walk into Ubud but away from the main hustle and bustle. Apart from a little construction noise next door (unavoidable and it did not bother us) the hotel was very quiet, enabling us to get the sleep and relaxation we needed during our holiday. Can we go back now please?

Put simply, this hotel is one of the best hotel's I've ever stayed in and I would recommend a stay here to anyone who wants a relaxing and luxurious stay in Ubud with 5* service at a very reasonable price. Enjoy!
title: One of the best (and cleanest) hotels I've ever stayed in! Simply wonderful!

text:
This wonderful B&B is within walking distance to downtown Ubud, yet away from the busiest streets. What you see on their website is what you get: large and tastefully decorated rooms, small, but lovely pool overlooking rice fields and fantastic, lush garden with gazebos. There's a cell phone at your disposal in case you need help while exploring Ubud. Apart from the breakfast, this place also offers afternoon tea/coffee with a snack. Very friendly and understanding staff – they will do their best to make sure you enjoy your stay in Ubud.

Although we didn’t stay as long as we’d like, we’ll definitely consider this place for any future trips to Bali.
title: Just great!

text:
This litlle hotel is runned by a family. 
They are so warm, helpfull, try to fix everything you can possible need there. 
I was alone so they drive me to some places and pick me up after some hours ( with no extra cost!!!), give me a cellphone just is case Im lost or need something extra.  aweasome, travel a lot alone  and never ever have this kind of attention. :)
The room is new, everything is nice there. 
People friendly, nice, open heart, like a family, really.
Beautiful view of the terraces, nice /litlle swimming pool.
They was also very nice to tailor made my options of rhe breakfast, a helpfull touch .
Really recommend Byasa Ubud!
title: Lovely Experience at Byasa Ubud

text:
I'm an avid traveler so I've stayed at hotels in 20+ countries around the world, and I can say with certainty that Byasa stands out as my clear favorite!

First of all, the hotel itself only has a few rooms which gives you the impression that you're staying at your own private villa.  I hardly ever heard noise from the other guests, so it was very serene.  Most times, you can have the pool all to yourself.

The room itself is gorgeous- SO BIG- very tastefully decorated and the bed is very comfortable.

But what stands out to me most about this hotel is the staff.  They go above and beyond to cater to your every need.  From the moment you arrive, they treat you like royalty, always remembering your name and greeting you whenever you come and go.  By the end of my week stay, they were like family to me!  

The hotel is also in the perfect location- 5-10 minute walking distance from downtown Ubud but set far enough back from the chaotic streets that it feels like you're in a hidden oasis.

Also, breakfast is amazing!  You can choose from a variety of options (the banana pancakes were my personal favorite) and have it delivered straight to your room at the time of your choice.  You can choose to eat it in your room, on your balcony, by the pool, or in the huts overlooking the rice paddies.
title: Best in the world!!!

photos.caption: You can choose to eat breakfast here overlooking the rice paddies!

text:
My friend and I stayed here for three nights whilst exploring Ubud.  The staff are super friendly, the place is beautiful with the pool, garden and rice fields.  Moreover, the location is on a quiet side street. However, it's a quick 10 minute walk up the street to many restaurants/shops.  They give you a little local phone with their number programed into it in case you run into any issues while out and about.  Love this place!

Pros:
Quiet Location
Beautiful lush garden/outdoor setting
Beautiful pool
Friendly staff
Awesome breakfast (ask for it in the little outdoor huts in the garden) - get the pancakes!

Cons:
None.

Would I stay again:
For sure!
title: Clean, beautiful, friendly and quiet!

text:
We stayed at Byasa for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. 
The hotel staff is adorable, helpful and reliable. 
Breakfast was AWESOME, pancakes, fruits, eggs, bread, tea. 
The hotel is also very clean, we every time enjoyed the swimming pool with the afternoon tea. The rooms are very big and the view from the balcony is just.. SPEECHLESS 
Overall, I really recommend it. It is a good place for couples but also families.
title: 100% IN LOVE !  I RECOMMEND IT

photos.caption: We loved our stay in this lovely hotel !!!!!
We loved our stay in this lovely hotel !!!!!
We loved our stay in this lovely hotel !!!!!
We loved our stay in this lovely hotel !!!!!
We loved our stay in this lovely hotel !!!!!
We loved our stay in this lovely hotel !!!!!

text: Lovely hotel. Highlights being: plentiful breakfasts the gazebo; pool overlooking a rice paddy which makes you feel removed from the outside world; spacious and airy rooms; and impeccable service from the family who run the hotel who really do go out of their way to help.
title: Impeccable

text:
We stayed here for 2 nights and it was a wonderful experience. The staff all knew our names and would greet us each time we passed them. 
The hotel itself is unique and lovely. A small, but beautiful hotel with luxuriously large rooms, a lovely pool overlooking some rice paddies and immaculate gardens. 
The hotel is run by a family who live in a building next to the hotel. The family and staff were some of the friendliest I have met in Bali. 
If you are on a budget, it is a little on the pricey side, but you are really paying for five-star treatment, and is great value for money considering how incredible the whole place was. 
Housekeeping twice daily (although the 2nd housekeeping is not all that necessary), ensures that your rooms are always spotless. 
I would definitely come back and recommend this hotel over any other fancy 5 star hotel in ubud.
title: Amazing stay

text: Byasa is the best hotel i ever stayed at. The owners and the whole staff are wonderful, and there is nothing they won't help you with. As a guest you are provided with a cellphone when you arrive, so that you can call the hotel in case you should need help with something. The setting is just beautiful with a big clean pool right next to a lovely rice field, which feels very private and relaxing. The room is very clean, nice and spacious with a big  comfy bed. After a day out in Ubud it almost felt like coming home. You also have a minibar with free water provided everyday. I will most definitly come back next time I'm in Ubud!
title: Best hotel experience ever!

text: When I arrived bleary eyed traveling from NY, Guste greeted me with a big smile, cold towel and refreshing beverage. The room was large, clean and beautiful - with a patio overlooking the pool and garden. You can walk in to town very easily and there are many art galleries on this street. The entire staff - Pande, Darma, Guste - were helpful before and during my visit. Arranging tours, ordering me food, and organizing my car to my next hotel. The breakfast, which was included, was delicious and an extremely generous portion. I couldn't have asked for a better welcome to Bali!
title: Beautiful and convenient

text: We had a wonderful stay in Byasa. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful,  room is spacey and clean. The owner is a very friendly guy. They even offer us a small phone just incase something happen when we are outside. We couldn't wish for a better place. Thank you Byasa.
title: Wonderful stay

text: This is a small lovely peaceful Boutique Hotel. Not very far into town. The managers and staff are so delightful happy and friendly. The gardens rooms and pool are sparkling clean. The cleanest I have seen. The pool and rooms 9 in total overlook a rice paddy. I was sick on my stay and they wanted to get me a doctor. Ayu made me a special drink which helped me. Have already booked for January with my husband.
title: Best stay in Bali

text:
There is almost an endless list of things that we absolutely adored during our stay, and I will try my best to highlight most of them:

• we have landed pretty late at the airport and our driver waited for us for around one hour more than the initial schedule that we offered.

• arriving at the reception on our first night, Gusde warmly welcomed us and inquired about our breakfast preference for the following day.

• we received a small telephone to carry with us in order to call the reception if we would like to have the breakfast in the room, or we could have taken it outside in case we would have gotten lost.

• breakfast is absolutely amazing, the fried rice and the pancakes with either the tea or coffee pots are exactly what you need in the morning. I was extremely excited to wake up just knowing what awaits us!

• we were lucky enough to also attend a small family gathering celebrating one year since the project started, and Ayu cooked so many delicious foods and invited us to try them along their family and friends.

• Ayu and her husband, which are the owners, put all their heart into the project, from the team that they have to the guests that arrive. We would not have enough words to thank them for their hospitality, it is without doubt one of my most enjoyable stays by far.
title: You are buying an experience.

text:
** HIGHLY RECOMMENDED **

Warm welcome, excellent cleanliness, amazing view, perfect location and sensational breakfast.

Staff is extremely kind and helpful, they arrange everything before you even think about it. Feels like you have a new family for a couple of days. 

A mobile phone is provided by the hotel just in case you get lost, or you would like to order the breakfast in the morning.

I am travelling quite a lot, and it is one of the best custumer service that I have seen so far, because they put their heart into the service. 

When we will come back to Ubud one day, we are definitely going to stay here again!
title: Beyond Expectations

text:
Beautiful, clean rooms with breathtaking views of rice paddies. 

Thank you Ayu and Pande for making our stay unforgettable and for letting us stay in your house for our last night . 

Highly recommended!
title: A special place full of heart

text:
I spent 3 weeks in Indonesia and this was hands down my best experience.  perfection!
The property is small and cozy and the entire staff knows you, welcomes you, and takes care of you.  While it is professional, it's also frirendly and like staying with family without being obtrusive..
The breakfasts alone are worth staying!!!  You can have breakfasts (which you have an amazing amount of choices to select) in your room, patio, or in these little huts over looking a small rice paddie.  I think I gained 5 pounds from the amazing home cooked breakfasts! ;)   if y ou are around in the afternoon, there is also tea/coffee and cakes  from 3-6 pm.  
The sweet couple who own the property handled my driver for an excursion and he was great, they offer scooter rentals so you don't have to go through the hassle with outside places, and they also provided me with a map and a personalized tour of local temples. 
I didn't need it because my phone works, but they also provide a local cell phone so you can contact them!  
It's outside the main area of town, which I preferred because it is so busy.  the staff will give you rides to the main area of town, but it's really only a 15-20 min walk and it's a grreat reprieve from the hustle and bustle of Ubud.  

I fell in town and sliced up my legs.  I'm a total clutz.  I came limping back and bleeding and the entire staff rushed to my assistance and helped clean me up!  So sweet!!   Not only that, but I was going off to the Gilis after my stay here and they booked my tickets for me and made sure I knew how to go through the ferry/bus process when I came back.

I cannot express how wonderful this property is and how relaxing it is.  I'll be coming back to Bali/Indo next summer and I wouldn't miss this place!!
title: Don't even look further. Amazing!

text: Really enjoyed our stay, it is a small family run hotel we're the service is a good as I have experienced in Bali. The room is big and modern with a huge comfortable bed. The pool is just right and at times all your own. Located just a small walk from the center of town. I would recommend to all.
title: Byasa Ubud - Paradise. Marina & Rob

text:
We were so delighted to stay at Byasa Ubud. It is a small new hotel with lots of perfection and personal touch. Big room and bathroom, king size bed, cleanliness, helpful staff, delicious breakfast and afternoon tea and beautiful garden  are all  awesome. 
Ayu's smile melts away every exhaustion. She is so helpful for anything we need. 
I feel this hotel should be rated with 4*.   Definitely will come back to Byasa. All the best to you Ayu.
title: TOP NOTCH PERFECTION - Halim & Regina

text:
My husband, daughter and myself stayed at Byasa for three nights. from the 9th May to 12th. This was our first visit to Bali and selecting Byasa was a great choice. Before arriving in Bali, I had many queries and Ayu very patiently responded promptly. This was the first sign of team Byasa's excellent service.

Byasa is nine room boutique style small hotel therefore it is a quiet, peaceful and you feel at home. All  rooms have balconies facing the lush paddy field and the rooms on the ground level has direct acces to the pool. 

Ayu her husband and the rest of the staff were at our service, if you stay at Byasa Ubud there is nothing one needs to worry about. Byasa will take care of you, organising a tour, where to eat, want a taxi, were to go...ask Byasa. Ayu's home cooking is delicious as well, great breakfast of your choice and evening tea with home made local sweets included in your stay.  

Some of the places that could be done from Byasa are:
My favourite was the Campuan Ridge Walk
Lake Batur and on the way visit Tirta and Gunung Kawi temple.
Lake Bratan, Ulun Danu Temple and Jatiluwih rice terraces

If you are looking for a clean, comfortable and realxing place to stay, would highly recommend Byasa with it's great host.
title: Byasa In Ubud - A Perfect Stay

text:
Excellent stay. Hosts made us welcomed, and looked after us in the duration of our stay. 
Very tidy place, excellent  breakfast, friendly staff. 
Good value for money and will stay again. 

Well done and Good luck Ayu!!!
title: Oleg & Margarita

text:
We stayed here for 4 nights and have rarely encountered a hotel with more friendly and helpful personell!
They help you with everything you ask and are especially well prepared for helping you to plan your days in and around Ubud. They can organize drivers, cooking classes, etc. etc. or just give you tips on where to drive on your own.
Even before our departure they sat down with us and gave us helpful tips on what to do next in Bali.
All of them were always friendly and made you feel welcome with a warm smile on their face.

The rooms are fantastic as well! Very spacious and clean with a king size bed, flatscreen TV and all amenities you can ask for.

The view from the terrace and the pool is really nice, towards some rice fields. We always looked forward to hanging out there after a day of excursions :)

Highly recommend! Can hardly imagine a better place to spend your time in Ubud!
title: Perfect service

text:
The owners were so helpful with all of our needs, from excursions in Ubud to booking our onward travel plans. Their English is very good, and they went out of their way to ensure our stay was absolutely perfect. The hotel is very private & secure, overlooking a beautiful rice paddy. The room is extremely clean, colourful, spacious with a fridge, safe, and good AC. The staff are all so friendly, and drove us by motorbike to the monkey forest. Pande even brought me to a nearby silk store (called Corsica) that the locals shop at for good quality material! Breakfast and afternoon tea are amazing; Ayu's home cooking is delicious. The welcome drink with cold cloth was a bonus. They even loan their guests a local cell phone to call the hotel if you got lost or have any questions. 
We would come back to Ubud just to stay at Byasa since Ayu & Pande go above & beyond to make their guests feel like they are at home!
title: PERFECT!

text:
This was one of the best hotel on our trip trough Asia. Very kind staff, always there to help you out. With a good recommendation for a restaurant,  walking you home in the rain with a umbrella or getting you a taxi.

We asked them for a taxi. They could not get one ontime. Then the owner of the hotel gave us a lift free of charge. This is more then good service

Breakfast was great. I liked the banana pancakes!

Room is nice and very clean.
title: Perfect little hotel

text: This hotel was perfect! My cousin and myself had finished two weeks volunteering in Tabanan and Ubud was on our to-do list before we were due to fly home. The hosts are fantastic, they honestly could not do enough for us! Our room overlooked the beautiful rice paddies and the breakfast was gorgeous. We even enjoyed a late-night dip in the pool! Great location for exploring Ubud and excellent value for money! Would most definitely return!
title: What a little gem!

text:
We only stayed 2 days there. But it was more than amazing. The staff are the most amazing people, from the moment you enter the property to the moment you check out, they are your best friends :) they (every single one of them) always remember your name and call you by your first name, they are willing to help with anything you might need, fix any problem you might have, they are just genuinely good people. 
The breakfast is home cooked, fresh & delicious (get the fried rice). The area is lovely and with a lot of restaurant and shops near by. 
The pool is great for an afternoon, they even offer you afternoon tea with local sweets on the house to have by the pool.
The property is 3 floors and there are no elevators, so if you have weak knees, maybe get the first or second floor. But the third floor offers more privacy. 
I can only say i love the whole staff and i would love to just go back there soon.
title: I cant think of anything they could do better :)

text:
This is the friendliest staff I have ever encountered, and I have travelled a lot in Europe, Asia, Australia and Africa. They made us feel right at home, the owners even made an attempt to get to know us and were unbelievably helpful in assisting us with booking excursions. They even took us to the monkey forest by scooter, even though it is only a 15 minute walk. As I said, I would live here if I could. Cannot say enough good things about it! Room is clean, staff is amazing, and the breakfast is so good! Homemade by the owners wife! 

Would totally recommend a stay here!
title: Amazing experience. Feels like home, I would stay here forever if I could.

text:
Pro:
+ extremely friendly owners
+ ricefield view
+ close to center
+ 5-star luxury
+ u get a mobile phone

Con:
- noisy

Nothing but the best to say about this place. Heartwarming welcome from ayou and her family who will include guests into their inner circle.
I think prices will go up in the future cause rooms are pure luxury.
Only thing was that you can here the street at nights, but we got used to that.
We extended our stay and would definetely cone back!

Danke für alles und macht weiter so!
title: Welcome to the family

text: Byasa hotel in Ubud is one of my favorite hotels that I've ever visited! The best part about this place is the incredibly friendly and caring staff. They began to feel like a second family to me during my stay. This hotel is very clean and comfortable. Everything looked new and was in great working condition. The morning breakfast that comes included in the stay was always fresh and delicious. Afternoon tea comes with a side of Ayu's fresh baked treats which are super yummy as well. I would highly recommended that you stay here, you won't regret it!
title: Awesome hotel!

text:
Despite the stellar reviews by other guests, I have rarely been this positively surprised by a hotel. The pool is nice and clean with beautiful views over the rice paddy. The rooms are spotlessly clean with nice spacious bathrooms and great AC. The location is good, relatively speaking. We mostly walked and walking in Ubud can occasionally be a bit of an adventure, which is not much of an issue because the staff are always happy to help with any transportation requirements. Breakfast has good variety and you can choose to eat at your room, your balcony or at the pagodas (or the pool i suppose).

The greatest thing about Byasa are the owners and the staff. It's a super friendly, extremely professional operation. The owners professionalism, expertise and will to go the extra mile did  not only make our stay in Ubud better but also helped with our plans for the remaining 2 weeks at Bali in a significant way. We have travelled around some but rarely been this happy with the value the service has added to our  travel experience.

If we return to Ubud, and we might, we will stay here again.
title: Above and beyond

text:
We stayed two nights and had a wonderful time! You can escape the noisy streets and still be close to the center because there are ricefields in the backyard of the hotel. Great place to relax and explore Ubud.

The room is very big and gets cleaned twice a day. The breakfast is amazing!
The owner and the staff are very friendly helpful and warm-hearted. 

We will definitely come back!
title: Sad we didn't stay longer

text:
I cannot recommend Byasa enough - though I only had three days in Ubud, owners Ayu and Pande went absolutely above and beyond in helping me plan my visit, book the best tours, and make the most of my limited time. 

Both are Ubud locals and beyond solicitous in making recommendations and helping out with anything you might ever need (moto rides to the center of town, restaurant/spa recommendations, airport-pick up, tips on navigating Nyepi related traffic madness!). 

Also, Ayu's breakfasts are delicious and filling - go with the noodles! Just a fabulous and peaceful place to stay.
title: Perfect little hotel in the middle of Ubud!

text: There was so much to like about the Byasa! First of all, the view from our room was gorgeous. All of the rooms have a private balcony that overlooks the rice paddies (and the pool!). The room was nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable. We ate our breakfast in the gazebo by the rice paddy each morning, but had the option of having breakfast delivered to our room as well. The breakfast was delicious and the pot of Bali coffee was a great way to start the day! The pool deck was a serene place to hang out, with towels provided and afternoon tea/coffee served. Definitely one of the most defining features of the Byasa were the staff. Everyone was so kind and went well out of their way to ensure we had a great stay!
title: Highly Recommended for your Stay in Ubud

text: What a fabulous hotel: from the welcome on arrival to the fabulous setting, from the clean and spacious rooms to the lovely breakfast. As a solo traveller also, I felt completely safe and I was able to ring the owners and they picked me up from central Ubud. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and recommend this place to anyone visiting Ubud!!
title: Lovely retreat with wonderful hosts

text: Great small boutique hotel, great rooms, great staff, great owners, simple but tasty breakfast served on your balcony, great pool with a view over the rice fields and a decent location only a 10 minute walk to many restaurants. The service was beyond excellent and previous reviews are more than justified. Thank you to everyone at the Byasa Ubud for making our stay memorable.
title: Great Hotel

text:
Everything is perfect here!

Pool is really lovely.

Nice, clean and spacious room. Clean bathroom. Kind and friendly staffs.

Real nice and friendly family runs this place. You will adore this place 100% sure.
title: You will love this place lots and lots!!

text:
I booked one night here after a recommendation from a friend I met at yoga retreat. She was already booked into a room and we travelled together to check in.  On arrival the beautiful host Ayu met us and without any hesitation made sure we could be in rooms with an adjoining balcony and went over and above to make sure we were going to be comfortable. 
That was the start of the most amazing service I have ever received anywhere. Our other friend Amy was waiting with our driver, but staying elsewhere. She was also given a welcome drink and cool towel. Then we were shown our rooms. ....Wow! Every detail is tasteful down to the beautiful origami towels on the bed and the freshest smells.
The place is immaculate!

We were even provided a mobile to use during the stay to call the reception if we had any problems even when away from byasa in the town.

The staff are so accommodating and genuinely beautiful. I'll definitely be back!
Thanks Ayu and your staff. Five stars! 🙏🏽 namaste 
Suzy
title: Absolutely amazing

text:
We stayed at this beautiful little hotel for 4 nights on our honeymoon. From the minute we arrived until the minute we were dropped off at our new hotel they went above and beyond. Everything you could possibly want they can organise. 

You couldn't ask for better hosts. We were made to feel welcome from the second we arrived, we were greeted with huge smiles and welcome drinks. The daily breakfast is delicious, it's delivered to your room. You're able to eat it wherever you like though whether that be in a little hut by the pool, next to the pool or on your balcony. They also have great food recommendations which they've personally tried themselves to make sure they recommend correctly. 

My biggest regret was booking all our tours before we got there. They can offer you amazing trips and tours for fantastic prices. 

It's about a 20 minute walk to the centre of town, that suited us just fine though! 

We're looking forward to coming back to see you guys!!!
title: Amazing - Book it now!!

text: Had a short 5 night stay with a friend here at Byasa and were blown away by the amazing service from Pande and Ayu, the husband and wife team behind the new hotel/resort. They went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and to attend to our every need, even driving us to the supermarket to help us get some snacks after arriving late from our flight. They were the friendliest owners of a hotel I have ever met, and the same went for all their staff. The grounds were gorgeous! A beautiful pool overlooking rice fields, banana, papaya and coconut trees, with lush foliage and gorgeous gazebos to sit in and have breakfast (which was delicious too and quickly made in under 10mins!) The rooms were clean, large with nice comfortable beds and clean bedding. The staff cleaned the rooms and made the beds everyday and provides fresh towels. The bathroom was also very large with fantastic rain shower head! Air con was great too and helped us to sleep during some hot nights! The location is also a big plus because unlike some hotels that are isolated, you would simply walk out the driveway into the hustle and bustle that is Ubud! We walked to Alchemy cafe and some markets and shops and temples. It was so convenient! The prices are very competitive and very reasonable. I can't wait to come back! I wish Pande and Ayu all the very best with their hotel; they sure are heading in the right direction! Good service and attention to detail is paramount! Thankyou!!!!
title: Amazing new hotel with excellent rooms and top service!!

text:
Stayed at the Byasa in Ubud with my daughter for 5 nights in adjoining rooms. Picked up by a driver from the airport and from that moment on it was a wonderful experience. The owners Ayu and Pande are great hosts and together with their friendly staff (who remember your names) are willing to help you with any queries you may have. The breakfasts each morning were beautiful and plentiful. The rooms are spacious and modern with everything you need. Beautiful pool and grounds. It was a easy 10-20 minutes walk to most of Ubud attractions. They helped arrange a day trip and transport back to Kuta. 

If I ever come back to Ubud I will definitely stay here again - exceptional service and great price - highly recommended
title: Paradise

text: Actually booked another hotel only to find that it was full and they had very kindly found the nearly new Byasa for me & I could not have been more happy. The room was large, pristine & beautiful. The service was so good it felt like being part of the family. The view over the rice fields and the wonderful swimming pool were just amazing and the suggestions for restaurants & walking tours around Ubud were wonderful.
title: Ended up here by mistake, didn't want to leave

text:
The reviews are spot on - this hotel is brilliant.

We stayed for a few nights during our time in Ubud and were 100% happy with our experience.

The pool is awesome, overlooking rice paddies. The rooms are modern, spacious and spotless. But, what really sets this hotel apart is the service.

Everyone you encounter is friendly, warm and genuine. The owners are the nicest people you could hope to meet. They are informative and helpful as well as taking a genuine interest in your time in Ubud. During our stay, I fell ill and the owner drove my girlfriend into town (as it was raining) to buy medicine. They also offered to give me anything I needed to feel better. This extra touch was very much appreciated and helped me enjoy my stay despite not feeling well!

If you can stay here, you should. Simple.
title: Amazing hotel with exemplary service!

text:
Before we booked this hotel we were a bit worried because of the unusually high reviews (how can a hotel receive the highest reviews from every single guest? :-)), but from the moment you arrive at the hotel you understand that all these reviews are well deserved.
 The owners Ayu and Pande, as well as their friendly staff are the best hosts. Very lovely people, always smiling and ready to help. They know each and every guest by name and do their best to make your stay at Byasa as nice as possible!
The hotel rooms are spacious, spotless clean and you are greeted with the cute towel foldings as shown on the photos :) 
The day we arrived we were given a cellphone with a local SIM to be able to communicate with the staff whenever we needed.  
Only downside: we wanted to spend couple of days at the seaside in Bali, but we loved Byasa so much that in the end changed our plans and stayed at Byasa only:)

In short, it's a great hotel with the best service ever.
title: Best hotel service I've ever had

text:
There is a reason this hotel has only 5/5 reviews, quite simply a stay here is wonderful and there is nothing to fault the hotel over. 

The rooms are spacious, spotless, and very modern. The grounds are stunning with a lovely pool, rice paddies and gazebos. The management pictures are a very accurate depiction of the rooms..what you see is what you get.

The location is slightly away from the centre but still within a 20-30min walk, and the serenity and views make it totally worthwhile. 

Despite not having a restaurant, a simple but filling and tasty breakfast is served to you on your balcony at any time you specify.

Finally the hospitality is unbelievable, from the moment you arrive you are greeted by the friendliest staff, there was not one person working at Byasa that did not stop to say hello, ask about your day, be smiling and be ready to help you with any needs! The owners Pande and Ayu live on grounds and are so lovely, they will help you with any of your needs to the best of their ability.

Now stop reading and book your stay at Byasa your only regret will be not wanting to leave!!
title: Exceptional hospitality in a wonderful hotel

text: Pande is a wonderful host. This new hotel is super clean and has a gorgeous pool overlooking the rice fields and a temple. I loved sitting out at the pool and swimming. It is close to everything in Ubud but is actually very quiet and feels removed from the bustle. Great place to stay!
title: Gentle breeze off the rice fields in the centre of Ubud!

text:
We booked this based on the 5/5 reviews and they were right! New boutique hotel with only 9 rooms, lovely pool, fantastic rooms with everything you need and the icing on the cake is the owners. Ayu and Pande know how to run a hotel and looked after us so well, we booked a day tour through them with a trusted driver Adil and he was great, very knowledgable and friendly. Can't say enough what a great find this is. It's quiet as its away from the centre but only a 20 min walk in to the restaurants.
Also go to Warung Biah Biah for excellent local food that is super cheap and tasty!
title: Fantastic boutique hotel, reviews are spot on!

text: I booked Byasa purely off reviews that I had read and they did not disappoint. The fairly new hotel is located very close to Ubud central which can be reached by purely walking. There are also some good restaurants within walking distance. The owners and staff are very friendly and welcoming. They always greet you and ask what your plans are, etc. They are there if you need anything. The hotel and rooms itself were very clean with a spacious room and bathroom. We were at the top floor which had a balcony with a view of the lovely pool and rice fields. When we arrived to our room, we were greeted with a lovely surprise of rose petals across the bed and Happy honeymoon. As they do not have a restaurant or dining area on site, breakfast is either served in your room on the balcony or outside by the pool. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. Variety is not big but it tasted good. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend Byasa.
title: Highly recommended

text:
Ayu and Pande, the wife and husband owners of this new B&B, are the most wonderful local Balinese people and provide the utmost personalized attention and service to ensure you enjoy your stay. We felt like we were staying with good friends, even from day one. They helped us organize our time in Ubud, from arranging drivers, to booking activities and recommending restaurants.

The rooms are very clean and modern, even by US standards, and the breakfast is delicious! Fantastic value for money. Cannot say enough good things about this place, the owners, and entire staff. A++
title: Exceptional, Enjoyable Stay! Best Hosts, Clean Facilities, Excellent Value for Money

text: Perfect location, away from the hustle and bustle of town area, quiet and peaceful, with fantastic view of the rice field. Boutique style accommodation, Byasa Ubud offers serenity, clean and comfortable rooms and great choices of breakfast menu. We had a wonderful holiday retreat with our children, Sofia and Asher. Fast WIFI connection and no mosquito! Thank you, Ayu and the team at Byasa. We appreciate your hospitality and kindness.
title: Serenity with great Hospitality in Ubud

text: We would give Byasa 6 stars if we could. Great location, out of the hustle and bustle but very walkable to everything in Ubud. Pande and Ayu were the perfect hosts. They were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms, pool etc. were immaculate and everything including the garden very well maintained. Breakfast was delicious, especially Nasi goreng. Gorgeous, open views over the pool and rice paddies which are owned by the local temple. So relaxing. We took a day tour with Alid which was also excellent. Only problem was leaving. Highly recommended+++ Best place we have stayed in Bali.
title: Faultless!

text:
The staff were absolutely amazing and accommodated our every need, including a very early morning check-in due to an overnight flight. Super friendly and very easy to talk to, we went in as hotel guests and left as friends.
The food was fantastic, as was the cleanliness of the facilities/room! Absolutely recommend and our only issue was that we didn't stay longer.
title: Exceptional service, cleanliness and aesthetics

text: The hotel is barely 6 months old. Everything is new and impeccable! The location is very central to Ubud and since it is not on the main road noise is not an issue. The view from the rooms overlooks the infinity pool and rice fields. If you are looking for a hotel with a Balinese feel but want the cleanliness and modernity from back home this is the perfect place to stay!
title: New, Clean, Quiet and Charming!

text:
I stayed here for a week with my friend and it was totally over our expectation! We were welcomed by a big smile, exotic drink, and cold tissues during the check-in. They gave us a selection of breakfast menu for the next morning and asked us what we prefer. On the way taking us to the room we had a great warm conversation with Ayu. This warm welcome made us feel like at home. 
The room were spacious, comfortable and relaxing. Bathroom and the beds were very clean. The swimming pool were looking very beautiful surrounded by rice field. 
Next morning the breakfast was really tasty! Everyday we ate nasi goreng or mie goreng together with delicious banana pancake and fresh fruits. We loved nasi goreng and mie goreng ohh that's awesome. The best of it we have tried until now. For breakfast Balinese coffee and banana pancakes were also gorgeous. 
The owners helped out us to find guides, daily trips and also shuttle to airport. The prices were quite reasonable. Even to enter to the temples they provided us sarong, that was great :)
Overall our stay was awesome and definitely we will come back again. You can see that all the staff is working happily. It's real hospitality!
title: Unique experience

text: During our stay in this hotel we experienced unique service and atmosphere. House, rooms, pool – everything is new, beautiful and cozy. Breakfast – to your balcony or in a beautiful Balinese open porch + tasty and  nourishing. Near the hotel is rice field, where every day ducks walk around, so Balenese atmosphere is around + no noice from the street. Moreover, you can rent new motorbikes from the hotel – very convenient. In addition to that, hotel owners are always ready to help guests in any situations (advice on a day route, plan some excursion for normal price (without overpricing), tickets to other islands. Plus they help in critical situations. For example, when we went to another island – Lombok, we could not get out tickets in the harbour, workers there were not supportive. So hotel owner – Ayu was supporting us via phone and talking to locals many times and we finally got on out boat only with her help. And generally it was like coming home every evening, when we were asked how did it go today, advised what where to buy and which prices are affordable and which are overpriced. We enjoyed our stay!
title: Unique great experience in lovely boutique hotel with true Balinese view

text: My wife and I have spent four nights in this family regency new hotel and all the staff have been very kind and serviceable. Felt like beig at home. It has only nine rooms and they are very clean, wide and comfortable. There is also a small pool besides a rice field. If sometime we return to Bali we'll go back to this hotel for sure.
title: Small, quite and peaceful hotel in Ubud

text: We had a very nice and relaxing 7 days stay at this nicely designed, brand new boutique hotel in Ubud. Byasa Ubud, It is strategically located in a walking distance from nice spas (Jaen Spa and many others), great dining places (Cumuda Cafe, Taco Casa, WHo'S WHo and many others). For those who would like to discover other Ubud areas, Byasa provides scooters to hire, or can arrange a taxi at descent rates. All Byasa rooms face rice fields and the swimming pool (which quite big in size and was always spotlessly clean). Byasa rooms are very spacious, comfortable and have a large balcony (2nd and 3rd floors) or pool terrace on the 1st floor. We were staying in a room on the 3rd floor; the views from our room were amazing, The owners, Ayu and Pande are a lovely mid 30s couple, very friendly and generous people; they live in their reception building, which is next to the hotel, and they are always easy to approach at any time. Ask Ayu to cook for you chicken wings or other local food and you will be amazed by the taste. The Byasa staff speak good English, look and act very professionally, always very courteous  and doing their best to make your stay as comfortable as possible. We absolutely loved our stay at Byasa and highly recommend this accommodation.
title: Loveley boutique hotel, great hospitality, comfirtable accomodation and now is our favorite stay in Ubud.

text:
This is a fantastic new hotel, with only 9 good sized rooms with all modern requirements in lovely Balinese style. The owners, Pande and Ayu are so fantastic- they made us feel so welcome and whilst we were happy to wander into the centre of Ubud and then enjoy time by the lovely pool, they clearly would have helped us to arrange any tours, and staff were happy to offer suggestions about where to eat. Breakfast in the gazebo at a time to suit us was memorable, and we happily watched a huge variety of colourful birds flit about, whilst rice was planted in the paddies immediately surrounding the hotel. This is a little piece of heaven in Ubud, and we wish the family every success in this venture. 

We were very sad to leave.
title: Beautiful, modern, relaxing

text:
Walking distance front Ubud.  Beautiful surroundings. 5 star accommodation,  spotlessly clean. Excellent breakfast.
Ayu and Pande are the best hosts I have ever come across. They  will do anything and everything to help you with transportation, tours, restaurants, shops....they always have great tips about local attractions and will get out of their way to make it easy for you.
There isn't a better place in Ubud. I will go there again.
title: haven of tranquility near town

text: This place is perfect! The staff were amazing and super friendly, Ayu and Pande go out of their way to make you feel welcome and enjoy your stay. The rooms are stunning, great amenities and great views over some rice fields. The breakfast was delicious. My partner is a gluten free vegan and they made sure she was able to enjoy the banana pancakes (which were so good!). We even got to try some local cuisine over breakfast, the black rice pudding was one of our favourites! During our stay we were lucky enough to enjoy a royal cremation ceremony which Pande took us too, and then their Galungan festival which Ayu took us too! We loved this place so much we ended up staying here for 2 weeks! You won't find anywhere better than this place, we already can't wait to return.
title: Just amazing!

text: We booked 3 nights at this hotel based on many excellent reviews on the TripAdvisor. Our stay exceeded all our expectations. This is a gem of a hotel built and run by a young couple( Ayu and Pande) who started Byasa in June, 2016. In every respect, this is how a small hotel should be. With only 9 rooms. All rooms are large, modern and simply but beautifully finished. Beds are large and comfortable. The barthrooms are large with rain shower. Each room has a veranda or a balcony overlooking a lovely swimming pool. The best part is the hospitality of Ayu, Pande and their whole staff. A wonderful service with genuine interest in their guest and always a lovely smile. Lovely breakfast of your choosing  is served  on your balcony or the Gazebos. Home cooked lunch/ dinner can be ordered. Ayu and Pande have scooters to rent on the premises and can arrange taxi or trips. Avoids all the hessels of dealing with the streets touts. This is one of the best small hotel we have stayed in in every respect. As Ayu and Pande are starting with this venture, We wish them every success. Don't change a thing Ayu and Pande, you have got every thing right.
title: Sheer Perfection of an hotel

text: Our family had wonderfull stay at Byasa! Staff is incredible friendly and helpfull,they even provide local mobile phohe to every of spacious rooms, so you can call them at any time. Location is so relaxing, you look at rice field from your room. I strongly recommended to everyone.
title: Outstanding stay

text:
I don't know where to start to describe Byasa and the wonderful staff and owners as I don't think words do this place justice!! It was a wonderful two days and my husband and I were both very sad to leave. Byasa was by far one of the best places we stayed while we were in Bali and Ayu & Pande were helpful and very kind hosts. The rest of the staff were also very friendly and always smiling. It somehow felt much more genuine and homely here than anywhere else.

Ayu & Pande have built an excellent home away from home for their guests and the quality and standards of Byasa are outstanding. The cleanliness of the place was impeccable and everything is spotless and new. 

There were so many great little touches that made our stay extra special - the lovely smell of the clean pool towels, the little animal towels on the bed, the insanely delicious breakfast, the large umbrellas outside our room for when it rains, the kindness of Ayu & Pande and even the ducks & water buffalo in the rice paddy! 

The banana pancakes were SOOOO good and my husband ordered the noodles which was the best Indonesian food we've tasted so far throughout the whole trip! 

We LOVED our room as we just walked out and straight into the pool. Our stay was so relaxing and peaceful and I enjoyed doing my morning yoga on our little veranda with the view of the pool and rice paddies. 

Wifi was great here - no problems at all. We hired a motorbike from Pande which looked brand new and even the helmets were new (unlike other places we've rented from). We were also given a mobile phone for use in case we needed to contact Ayu or Pande. A very thoughtful touch. 

Thank you so much Ayu & Pande and we wish you much success with Byasa!
title: Peaceful, Relaxing, Incredible Stay!

text: Great-superb-extraordinary friendly staff, they will try to help you with everything (trip, driver, restaurant, scooter...); great breakfast; great location, close to everything but you still stay in a calm environment with a ricefield in front of you and the sound of frogs, ducks,...; very Clean and comfortable rooms; ...
title: Only positive things to tell!

text: Just total perfection! My husband and I cannot rate Byasa Ubud highly enough. Being avid travellers, we have stayed in accommodation all over the world. Genuinely, Byasa Ubud is our favourite. We were so sad when we had to leave, we could have happily stayed indefinitely. From the moment we booked, Ayu was prompt and efficient at relpying to our emails. Upon arrival, we received a very warm welcome. The staff could not do enough for us. The welcome drink was just delicious: homemade, healthy and refreshing, which coupled with the refreshing towles provided instant relaxation. We were immediately hit with the wow factor when seeing the pool overlooking the rice fields with ducks wandering through (on our last day, water buffalo appeared!). The little gazebos were a perfect touch overlooking the gorgeous view. Our room was just stunning. The little touches made it sheer perfection: the animal towels, petals on the bed, the furniture, balcony and bathroom were just stunning. The toiletries all smelt wonderful and we genuinely couldn't want for more; the rooms have all been completed to a very high spec. and everything has been thoughtfully considered (even down to the toilet!). We were given a mobile phone by the staff which we could use at any time and were able to book our breakfast the evening before. Ayu and her husband helped us tirelessly with hiring motorbikes (they provide motorbikes for a very good price), planning our days: they printed and annotated maps for us to follow and even helping us to arrange transport for our onward journey. They were faultlessly efficient and kind, as were all the other staff. One of our favourite parts of our stay was the breakfast! Just fantastic.We had it in the beautiful gazebo every morning at a time to suit us. I still dream about Ayu's banana pancakes. The best we have ever eaten!!! Along with the ginger tea, eggs and sauages with toast and fruit served in a wonderful gazebo with a stunning view, it was the most perfect breakfast. Ayu even made a cake for us to celebrate our anniversary. It was totally divine! The location is wonderful. A short walk into Ubud but far enough out to enjoy the peace and serenity of the rice fields. The only negative was that we had to leave! We are already thinking about coming back to Bali again, just to stay here. It will always be an unforgettable, special piece of paradise for us. Thank you so much for having us Ayu and Pande. We miss you and our morning chats over breakfast, learning about your family and culture.
title: Sheer excellence. Cannot rate this place highly enough. A firm favourite! Paradise.

text:
Where to start..  im a single woman travelling alone and am so blessed to have stumbled across Byasa. From the moment l arrived l instantly knew l was going to enjoy my stay. The hosts and all the staff are super friendly and did everything to make my stay everything l needed! When l arrived l was goven a small mobike phone to take with me, if l needed l could call reception if l needed anything, or just got lost, they were there to help! I loved this comfort as a single woman travelling solo.  Byasa is just out of the main area, approx a 25-30 min walk to the ubud market and 20 min walk to monkey forest. Or you can get transport for $5 into town. I hired a motorbike from the hotel for $6 a day! 
The breakfast was brought to my room and was more than enough, or you could done in downstairs. You must try the banana chocolate pancakes! 
The view from my room was amazing, rice fields, l found the ducks incredible to watch in the early evening and the men climbing trees collecting coconuts! 
The room was l couldnt fault, clean, crisp white sheets on the comfy king bed, plenty of lighting, a great air con, the bathroom towels smelt amazing, awesome shower! 
I definately would recomend this place!!
title: A secret paradise that ticked all my boxes!!

text:
Increíble estancia en un hotel precioso frente a arrozales y super cómodo, piscina impresionante, habitaciones amplias y nuevas, desayuno espectacular pero lo mejor sin duda la familia que lo regenta, super amables con ganas de ayudarte y explicarte que hacer en su encantadora isla de Bali. 100% Recomendable !!! 

Amazing days at Byasa Ubud!!! Magnificent Hotel just in front of wonderful rice terraces with a great pool and super comfortable rooms as well. But for us the greatest was the family who owner the hotel, so kindly and helpful people who gives you their better advices to visit Bali and Ubud area. We highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Thanks Ayu & Family, We hope to see you again!!!
title: Espectacular Hotel y familia !!! Magnificient Hotel and great  Family  !!!

text: This hotel was a gem. Very good price for a beautiful room and great service. The hotel owners went out of their way to help us with anything. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Ubud! We will be staying there again.
title: Best hotel in Ubud

text: They say the meaning of the word byasa is ordinary but i don't think so. Our stay in this hotel was extraordinary. Everything was great. Thanks to the very humble owners Mr. Pande and Mrs. Ayu who are always ready to assist the guests with all their needs. The location of the hotel is near the center but the surrounding is very relaxing with the view of rice paddies. Rooms are big with extra large and comfortable beds. Mobile phone is provided where you can contact the hotel anytime. Scooter is available for rent which we used the whole time we stayed in ubud. Breakfast is delicious especially the homemade banana pancake and having it in gazebo is memorable. Definitely we'll come back.
title: Higly recommended hotel for a realxing vacation

text:
That was a real pleasure to discover this magnificent hotel who is managed by a beautiful couple. I would like to thank them for everything that made our stay perfect. I really recommend this hotel for everyone. you'll enjoy everything, starting from the breakfast, the pool, the view, the room... 
You can rent a motorcycle if you want to go you bud central or to walk like 10min to go to some of the best restaurants in ubud. 
I already miss this place and hope to come back soon and thanks again for your perfect service
title: Perfect

text:
We unfortunately needed to leave the country early and were not able to enjoy our booking. Ayu was very kind and understanding about this change, and showed a value of family in her response. 

Thank you, it is much appreciated. We wish you all the very best.
title: Very kind and understanding

text: excellent new strucure with ricefield view.close to city center . high value for money possibility to rent motorbike . clean room and  good qualified staff . breakfast is included with possibility to order what you like the day before
title: amazing

text: Byasa is great. Our best hotel on our Indonesia trip. The owners are really nice and helpfull. Breakfast is great and the rooms are fantastic. They made an awesome place. In the center of Ubud with silence and relaxing near ricefields. They did an amazing job. We will come back when we visit Ubud again. You have to stay at this place where everybody is nice and happy.
title: Amazing

text:
Even if we are frequent travelers we don't write many reviews but Byasa deserve one
This brand new guest house has the standards of a high quality hotel (Rooms are huge and super clean with high quality furnitures and King Sized and comfortable bed, the pool is modern with a nice views on rice fields) with the heart of a homestay. In fact what makes Byasa so special is the kindness of the owners kardika and dewi, friendly helpful and gentle like no one
Also the position is great. Located at a walk distance from the center of ubud but on a quite Rice field that makes you forget about the chaos and noise of the outside
For sure the best quality/price rate we ever had (it worth the double)
If you need a place to stay in ubud don't miss this occasion
title: A piece of heaven

text:
This is not a hotel  — this is a country house of friends)) Thank you very much for the warm welcome, interesting stories about life in Bali and caring. The biggest impression of Bali is the people. We are very pleased to meet this Byasa family. (By the way, if you stay here, be sure to ask about the name of the hotel - Byasa).

It has a cozy territory, spacious rooms and very quiet. (Or we were lucky with the guests, everyone was polite and quiet). For us, this is one of the main criteria for housing. We work remotely.

It should be noted the excellent food! The breakfast menu can be selected in advance. They cook perfectly. There is afternoon tea and wonderful local sweets.
Very clean rooms (cleaning can be twice a day). Good sound insulation.
Near the hotel there is an art gallery, a forest of monkeys, many temples, as well as a supermarket and several good restaurants (for example, a restaurant with Russian food, there is buckwheat for those who are bored:)

And we already miss this place. Your forever Byasa guests)
title: This is not a hotel  — this is a country house of friends

text: Arrived early, so was able to leave a bag at the hotel while I went out. Very accommodating with an early check in and swim towel after I returned from the morning of exploring Ubud. Great communication through WhatsApp and lovely dinner. Rooms are huge and very well appointed with all necessary amenities.
title: Great staff and property

text:
Byasa is a small family run hotel (only 9 rooms!) Owners Pande en Ayu are very friendly and kind. The staff is well trained and are just as hospitable as the owners They greet you by your name and really make you feel welcome.
The rooms are very spacious, modern, air conditioned and well maintained. Great beds - and we are very picky at that… Modern and comfortabele bathroom featuring a rain shower.
Great view on the pool and rice field. Breakfast is served fresh daily, so is the  afternoon tea that is brought to whatever place on the grounds you like.
Ubud centre is on the doorstep, but you really feel far away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud. More than enough bars and restaurants in the neighborhood to eat end be entertained.
Ayu kindly arranges motorbikes and drivers at fair prices. Thanks for that, Ayu!
We run a small hotel ourselves in The Netherlands so we know what hospitality is all about. This hotel and its staff does a perfect job on hospitality. Thank you, Ayu, Pande and great staff.
Highly recommended!
title: Definitely worth more than 3 stars! Great hospitality!

text:
Had the pleasure of staying here for two nights, I do wish it had been more. Customer service of staff, and owners made me feel so at home as a solo traveller. Rooms were exceptionally clean, and serviced twice daily. Garden was well maintained and a nice little oasis out of the hustle. Cute little restaurant over looking the rice paddy's. I found the walk into the main part of Ubud easy, but may not be for everyone with some uneven footpaths to navigate. I will
most definitely stay again. Thanks so much for my stay!
title: Hidden Gem

text: Lovely quiet, picturesque location in busy Ubud with extremely friendly, helpful owners and staff. Our stay started with the owner personally guiding us through the quiet back streets to the Yoga Barn which is only 7 minutes walk away. Everyone at Byasa went above and beyond to help us including resolving a booking  issue, finding a lost phone ( after we had left) and booking transport. We were made to feel very welcome and nothing was a problem. All staff were incredibly polite and helpful. We highly recommend Byasa - Ian and Liz
title: Byasa Ubud - excellent place to stay

text: Recently came back from our vacation in ubud and we stayed @Byasa hotel.I can see why this place has got so many ģood reviews.This hotel is at a good location,has clean space,beautiful view by window and pool, regular housekeeping when you are away,good breakfast and meal options.Most importantly they value their customers and that is seen in their quality of service.An instance worth mentioning, is their sweet gesture when they came to know it was our anniversary.The bed was decorated ,we were gifted a bouquet,cake and even candle light dinner was arranged for us.Owners Pandey and Ayu are wonderful people, who treat you like family and that reflects in their staff too.Dharma,Gusti and all others were very humble,polite & helpful.Overall we had a great stay and would love to go back again.

text: I’ve been meaning to write this review for a while, and have stayed at Byasa around 3 times now. The staff are lovely and always ready to help with a smile. It’s set walking distance to the main strip, with a few easy options for eats/drinks nearby. They also have a restaurant attached to the hotel but I didn’t make use of that. The rooms are large with good aircon, tv with English channels, comfortable bed and large bathroom. They also offer afternoon tea with a little treat which I loved. Breakfast is a lovely spread and the view you get to enjoy over the rice paddy is a great way to start the day. My favourite is the pool, overlooking the rice paddy and surrounded by greenery, such a great place to relax! I’d definitely recommend Byasa.
title: Beautiful hotel

text:
On the southern end of the main tourist area, Byasa is set back from a busy road  behind a row of local businesses. All 9 rooms are fronting rice paddies and are quiet and peaceful, giving  a sense of distance and open, airy feel. The setting is leafy and the hotel grounds well maintained. The rooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. Equally appealing is the wonderful service with great attention to detail. All staff are helpful, friendly and always focused on making your stay even more pleasant. Breakfast is served individually to order (pancakes, fruit, eggs or rice/noodles etc) and we thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary afternoon tea/coffee.
ARMA is basically next door, so you have easy access to a very interesting museum , cultural workshops and performances. If you like morning yoga, ask for directions for the back way to the Yoga Barn, and enjoy the walk through the local neighbourhood.
title: Hidden gem

text:
Stayed for 3 nights. Was a wonderful experience. Where do I start:
Room - Clean, spacious and impressive bathroom. Overlooking beautiful rice fields. Comparable to 5 star.
Service- the best I've ever had. Staff very helpful and always smiling. My wife fell sick on first day arriving from Bangkok and the owners & staff made her feel at home and really cared for. The owners offer that nice personal touch. They even planned and booked our site seeing at a very affordable price.
Food - tasty and clean. Must try the pork ribs and corn fritters.

Overall a heavenly experience and good value for money. I would recommend my friends/family without hesitating,  and would love to be back soon. 
Love from Divya and Saf
title: Amazing stay!
